video_caption: The video begins with a white screen that transitions to a blue and red graphic displaying the text "LWV LEAGUE OF WOMEN VOTERS OF PORTLAND" in white letters, surrounded by stars and stripes. This is followed by a red screen with a blue banner reading "Video Voters' Guide ELECTION 2020 Candidate Portland City Commissioner Position 2 Julia DeGraw." The scene then shifts to a woman with blonde hair, wearing glasses, a green turtleneck, and a black blazer, sitting in a room with a blue vase of flowers and framed pictures on the wall. The text "LWV Colleen Shoemaker League of Women Voters of Portland lwvpdx.org" appears at the bottom of the screen. The video then shows a split-screen view of two women, one in the same room as before and the other in a different room with a painting of a tree on the wall. The text "Video Voters' Guide League of Women Voters of Portland lwvpdx.org" is displayed at the bottom. The video concludes with a red screen featuring a blue banner with the text "LWV LEAGUE OF WOMEN VOTERS OF PORTLAND" in white letters, surrounded by stars and stripes.

The video features a split-screen interview with two individuals. On the left, a person with short blonde hair, wearing glasses, a green turtleneck, and a black blazer, is seated in a room with framed pictures and a blue vase with greenery in the background. On the right, another individual with brown hair tied back, wearing a dark blue top and a necklace with red accents, is seated in front of a wall with a painting of a tree. The scene transitions to a close-up of the person on the right, with a text overlay reading "LWV Julia DeGraw Candidate Portland City Commissioner Position 2," indicating their candidacy for a city commissioner position. The background remains consistent, featuring the tree painting and a neutral-colored wall. The video maintains a professional and informative atmosphere throughout, focusing on the interviewee's expressions and gestures as they speak.

The video features Julia DeGraw, a candidate for Portland City Commissioner Position 2, speaking directly to the camera. She is wearing a dark blue top with a subtle pattern and a necklace with a red cord. Her hair is pulled back, and she has a focused expression. Behind her, a painting of a tree with a red heart at its center is visible on the wall, adding a touch of warmth to the setting. Throughout the video, Julia speaks with a calm and composed demeanor, occasionally gesturing with her hands to emphasize her points. The lighting is soft and even, highlighting her features without creating harsh shadows. At one point, a text overlay appears at the bottom of the screen, displaying the LWV logo and the website "Vote411.org" and "lwvpdx.org," providing viewers with resources for voting information. The overall atmosphere is professional and informative, with Julia presenting herself as a credible and approachable candidate.

The video features a woman wearing a dark blue dress with a pattern, a necklace, and red earphones, speaking directly to the camera in a room with a painting of a tree with a red light in the background. The scene transitions to a split-screen view, showing the woman on the right and another woman with short blonde hair, wearing glasses, a green turtleneck, and a black blazer, on the left. The background of the second woman includes a blue vase with flowers and framed pictures on the wall. The video then returns to the woman in the dark blue dress, with the "MetroEast" logo appearing in the bottom right corner of the screen. The video maintains a consistent focus on the woman in the dark blue dress, with no significant changes in her appearance or the background.

The background remains consistent throughout the video, with the painting of the tree visible behind the person on the right.

The woman's facial expressions and gestures change slightly as she speaks, and the background remains consistent throughout the video.

The overall atmosphere is professional and informative, with a focus on the speaker and the message being conveyed.

The video features two women engaged in a conversation, with one wearing a green turtleneck and black blazer, and the other in a dark blue top with a red necklace. They are situated in a room adorned with framed pictures and a blue vase with greenery. The scene transitions to a close-up of the woman in the green turtleneck, with a banner displaying "LWV Vote411.org lwvpx.org" at the bottom. The video then shifts to a blue screen with white stars and text that reads "League of Women Voters of Portland Presents The Video Voters' Guide," followed by a reminder to cast ballots for the Primary Election on May 19th, and a list of supporters including the Multnomah Bar Foundation, Carol & Velma Saling Foundation, Vernier Software & Technology, and The Wyss Foundation. The video concludes with a logo for MetroEast.org and a Creative Commons 2020 license notice.
